availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, James F. Robinson: Appointments by the Governor, Civil Appointments, 1862-1863

creation.placeName: New York City, New York State, New York

body.p:
State of New York
City and County of New York S. S.

I Daniel Seixas residing in the City, County, and State of New York having been appointed a commissioner of deeds for the State of Kentucky by the Governor thereof in and for the State of New York, do hereby solemnly swear that I will well and truly execute and perform all the duties of said commissioner to the best of my abilities

Danl Seixas
Commissioner for Kentucky
In New York

figure.ab:
DANIEL SEIXAS
COMMISSIONER
FOR THE
STATE
OF
KENTUCKY

body.p:
Sworn and subscribed to before me this Eleventh day of February A. D. 1863
Edwin F. Corey Jun
Commissioner for Kentucky in New York

figure.ab:
EDWIN F. COREY JR
COMMISSIONER
FOR
KENTUCKY

body.p:
New York
Comr of Deeds
Oath
Danl Seixas
Filed Feby 14. 1863
